summary: Email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York transmitting final, stamped versions of a GPS combo warrant application and related exhibits (Maxwell's indictment and arrest warrant) to an FBI recipient. This appears to be part of the legal process following Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.context: Appears as the email recipient with an NYPD email address, suggesting coordination between FBI and NYPD on the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the attached indictment and arrest warrant documents, indicating she is the target of the legal action.

connections.description: Byrne, as an FBI recipient, is involved in the legal process concerning Maxwell's indictment and arrest.

events.title: Application for GPS Combo Warrant for Maxwell
events.description: An application for a GPS combination warrant related to Ghislaine Maxwell was prepared, as indicated by the attached unsigned PDF filename.

events.title: Transmission of Final Legal Documents
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sent finalized, stamped versions of the GPS combo warrant and exhibits (indictment and arrest warrant) to the FBI.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email dated June 30, 2020, from a federal prosecutor transmitting finalized legal documents related to Ghislaine Maxwell.
Attachments include Maxwell's signed indictment, signed arrest warrant, and an application for a GPS combination warrant.
The communication shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and the FBI/NYPD regarding Maxwell's case post-arrest.
The GPS combo warrant application suggests authorities were seeking electronic monitoring or location tracking for Maxwell.
The email indicates the legal proceedings against Maxwell were actively moving forward in late June 2020.
